dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Habitat:  fast running, shallow water.  Bank vegetation bamboo forest.  Stream usually with some 50% shadow.

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Vishwanath, W. 2010. Devario strigillifer. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: The species is known from a small stream tributary to the Irrawaddy River, Myaing, central Myanmar, with an additional record for Mytkyna, northern Myanmar.

dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
DD
Data Deficient

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Vishwanath, W.

Reviewer/s
Barbhuiya, A.H., Rema Devi, K.R., Dahanukar, N. & Chaudhry, S.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification

More research needed to determine its current distribution, threats, and population structure of the poorly studied Devario strigillifer. Whether this species occurs in other areas of its range is unknown, but it appears in the aquarium trade. It is therefore listed as Data Deficient.
